issue.title: [bug] prometheus datasource multi-value template variable expand incorrect
issue.body:
Please include this information:
- What Grafana version are you using?
   4.6.3
- What datasource are you using?
  prometheus 2.0
- What OS are you running grafana on?
  ubuntu 16.04
- What did you do?
  plot multiple line with `  by (service)`
- What was the expected result?
   plot multiple line
- What happened instead?
   plot only the first 
- If related to metric query / data viz:
  `sum(rpc_durations_seconds{service=~'$serviceName'}) by (service)` only draw one line, I already selected `normal and uniform`, which is wrong  
   query inspector result is, which replace the $serviceName as `normal` instead of `(normal|uniform)` as document described
```
xhrStatus:"complete"
request:Object
method:"GET"
url:"http://kudu:9090/api/v1/query_range?query=sum(rpc_durations_seconds%7Bservice%3D~'normal'%7D)%20by%20(service)&start=1515404291&end=1515490631&step=600"
```

  - `sum(rpc_durations_seconds{service=~'normal|uniform'}) by (service)` draw two line correctly
 
from https://community.grafana.com/t/single-graph-with-multiple-plots-for-multi-value-template-variable/856 

I found some hint.
 I tried the play.grafana.com, which is correct. So I guess it is a new bug introduced in newer version.

Thanks!

Jiming

comment.body: Have you selected two values? No other reports on issues with multi-valued template variables for prometheus (and this is a very common setup) so it sounds strange.

issue.title: how to disable annotation query
issue.body:
grafana version:5.0.0_Beta1
datasource:simplejson
os: win7, 64
i want to disable annotation query, because i don't use this feature, but it will show annotation query failed error.
i Comment the annotation query code in simplajson code ,but it didn't work, still have annotation query
**how to disable annotation query?**

comment.body: the error looks very strange, can you open chrome dev tools and check console? the api requests looks to return 200 OK, so no error. What is the response from the /api/annotations request?

issue.title: [Feature request] Table plugin value mappings
issue.body: Could the Table plugin receive the same options to map numbers or ranges to text values as the singlestat plugin has. My current use case scenario is to show the association condition of ntp peers as outlyer, candidate, sys.peer etc, rather than the codes I use to store the time series.

issue.title: [Feature request] Table plugin value mappings
issue.body: Could the Table plugin receive the same options to map numbers or ranges to text values as the singlestat plugin has. My current use case scenario is to show the association condition of ntp peers as outlyer, candidate, sys.peer etc, rather than the codes I use to store the time series.

issue.title: Support Prometheus histograms in the heatmap panel
issue.body:
There are three things that need to be solved to support Prometheus histograms in the heatmap panel.

### Transform the histogram result into the format expected by the heatmap panel
Prometheus stores the values of each bucket incrementally. So we have to decrement each bucket in the Prometheus data source before sending it to the heatmap panel. I started working on that in a branch but it's out of sync with master. The transform function can be found at https://github.com/bergquist/grafana/blob/prom_heatmap/public/app/plugins/datasource/prometheus/result_transformer.ts#L21 and one test for the function can be found at https://github.com/bergquist/grafana/blob/prom_heatmap/public/app/plugins/datasource/prometheus/specs/result_transformer.ts#L17 Those can be used to get started quickly. 

### We need to handle Prometheus `+Inf` serie. 
In Prometheus, each histogram contains a serie named `+Inf` which is used whenever a value does not find in any other predefined bucket. This serie can help you decide if you should are more buckets or not. I'm not sure how to visualize this serie, if at all. If we decide to not show it we should remove it from the response when transforming the result into heat map format. 

### Exponential buckets 
Using the helper method in the Prometheus client libs you usually choose between Linear and exponential buckets. Would be great if the heat map panel could support this as well log base scales.

comment.body: @neopaf it's a default format for heatmap :)  not sure problem was in the format because it only converts histogram buckets from cumulative to regular. I think it's due to wrong label format, but not sure.

pull_request.title: Add value to text mapping support in table panel
pull_request.body:
Issue for this is https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/7119. ~I had this added on top of https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/9455 before but wanted to separate it from the text-to-value feature, so here it is :)~

This code replicates the behaviour from a singlestat panel to a table panel where values and value ranges can be mapped to text inside a table column.

repo.name: grafana
repo.description: Gorgeous metric viz, dashboards & editors for Graphite, InfluxDB & OpenTSDB
